thag1.116:1.1: A brahmin teacher named Pārāsariya (also spelled Pārāpariya or Pārāsiviya) features in [mn152](). In [ja222]() and [ja353]() another teacher warns that doing evil will lead to regret. The three similarly-named monks in the Theragāthā ([thag1.116](), [thag16.2](), [thag16.10]()) share the same clan name (Sanskrit Pārāśarya) as descendants of the great sage Parāśara.
